title: Danny O'Donoghue quit The Voice UK after personal tragedy
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The Script frontman Danny O’Donoghue opened up this morning about having to leave the judging panel of The Voice after its second series to care for his mother, who had a brain aneurysm.

Danny was part of the first ever The Voice UK judging panel, alongside Jessie J, will.i.am and Sir Tom Jones.

Speaking to Lorraine Kelly, the Irish singer revealed that he made the decision to go home to be with his family.

‘My mum had a brain aneurysm just after the second season,’ he revealed. ‘I thought everybody thought I just pulled off the show and just didn’t want to be there.’

The singer left the show during the peak of his career, having just hit number one in the UK singles chart with Hall of Fame, a duet with fellow coach will.i.am. He says that he was aware he was leaving the public consciousness at his commercial peak, but has no regrets.

‘I think people thought my star is rising,’ he said. ‘Why am I leaving?’

Danny was part of The Voice’s first UK coaching panel, with Tom Jones, Jessie J and will.i.am (Picture: Rex)

He agreed with the Scottish presenter, however, when she said that it’s always ‘family first’.

The Man Who Can’t Be Moved hitmaker admitted, though, that in his time of need, he didn’t have a seconds hesitation about rallying around his family and moving back to Ireland.

‘My family were back home in Ireland,’ he continued. ‘When something that devastating happens you rally around..’

The Irish star says that this traumatic event also inspired the band’s new album, Sunsets and Full Moons, which he says speaks to the darkness and the light the band experienced over the past few years.
